meanings.definition: Serving to excuse or provide justification.
meanings.sent1: Her excusatory behavior tried to justify her actions.
meanings.sent2: The excusatory tone of his voice indicated he was trying to explain himself.
meanings.sent3: The excusatory note she left on the table made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His excusatory attitude was like a shield protecting him from criticism.
meanings.sent5: The excusatory speech made a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: Offering an apology or explanation for a mistake or offense.
meanings.sent1: His excusatory words showed he regretted his actions.
meanings.sent2: She made an excusatory gesture to express her remorse.
meanings.sent3: The excusatory email he sent was heartfelt and sincere.
meanings.sent4: Her excusatory behavior was like a bandage on their wounded relationship.
meanings.sent5: The excusatory tone in his voice revealed his genuine apology.
